intro: Euonymus benthamii, commonly known as the Bentham euonymus, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Cercidiphyllaceae and is characterized by its small, deciduous leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It is often found in forested areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural use in gardens and landscapes.
